text: The first President of the United States was George Washington.
Abraham Lincoln was the sixteenth President of the United States.
Alexander Hamilton was a founding father who currently has a celebrated musical detailing his life and works on Broadway.
The only President to serve more than two terms was Franklin D. Roosevelt.
A rarity, Grover Cleveland was the only President to serve two non-consecutive terms.
At age 70, Donald Trump was the oldest person to be elected President.
The first President to live in the White House was John Adams, surprisingly enough.
Barack Obama was the first President born outside the contiguous United States. He was born in Hawaii.
On March 30, 1867, Andrew Johnson signed the treaty to purchase Alaska from Russia.
The first President to appear on television was Franklin D. Roosevelt, at the 1939 World's Fair.
